text: oh wow that's dope! you have no idea how many lines of code I've written trying to make the stata package for synthetic control useable.

text: Come join us! I've had this as a proof-of-concept for quite a while but me and Alex decided to try and get this to a good place

elements.text: Come join us! I've had this as a proof-of-concept for quite a while but me and Alex decided to try and get this to a good place

text: I think there's a real space in the market for a SynthControl package that allows easy estimation of all the recent extentsions (synthetic diff-in-diff, augmented synth control, staggered synth control etc.) which all exist as one-off R/Stata packages somewhere

elements.text: I think there's a real space in the market for a SynthControl package that allows easy estimation of all the recent extentsions (synthetic diff-in-diff, augmented synth control, staggered synth control etc.) which all exist as one-off R/Stata packages somewhere

text: I've just refactored this a few weeks ago to start of from a `TreatmentPanel` object takes in a table (DataFrame for now) and a specification of treatments (i.e. `id => time` pairs) and creates the relevant pre-/post treatment outcomes and covariates for treated and control units
